page.title: 04SHELTON WATER WORKS.
page.content: Shelton Water Works has been in operation since 1935 and was enlarged in 1971 due to increased demand. It supplis water to all of the Borough of Shrewsbury and to the villages along the A49 to just beyond Church Stretton. The water is pumped from the intake in the River Severn to settling tanks where chemicals are added to aid the first cleansing. It then passes through rapid gravity filters to remove any remaining dirt or grit. Samples are tested at each stage. Shelton Water Works has a storage capacity of 4\ million gallons in a clean water reservoir. From here, the water gravitates to the high lift pumping station and is then pumped into supply using the water tower as a balancing tank. Shrewsbury people use 5 million gallons of water each day.
